result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Sewilo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L. Sewilo

records.addlTxt: Transcript - Sentencing After Revocation, June 18, 2018
Dated 7/18/18 from DOC to Court requesting sentence credit review.
Dated 7/24/18 from Court to DOC regarding sentence credit.
of Completion of Representation

(Cases called at 3:05 PM- 15CF549, 15CF550, 17CF127, 18CF543, 18CF629, 18CT34)
Defendant Christopher L. Sewilo appears in custody with Attorney Mark Austin.  Attorney Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties discuss structure of revocation sentence as it relates to the anticipated probation in new cases.  Sentence credit determined as follows: 387 days in 15CF549, 660 days in 15CF550, and 82 days in 17CF127.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defense agrees with State's recommendation for sentence after revocation.  Defendant makes a statement.  (off record 3:22- 3:25)  Probation revocation sentence ordered: 1 year initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision in 15CF549, 1 year, 9 months initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision in 15CF550, 120 days jail, with Huber privileges, on each of Counts 1 and 3 in 17CF127 (all counts/cases concurrent to each other).  (off record 3:35- 3:38)  Defendant advised of elements and potential penalties of the charges to which he will plead.  Defendant acknowledges Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and is advised of his Constitutional rights.  Court finds defendant guilty based on pleas of No Contest to 18CF543 Count 1: Threat to Law Enforcement Officer (Repeater); 18CF629 Count 1: Identity Theft- Financial Gain (Repeater); and 18CT34 Count 1: Operating While Revoked.  Court costs only ordered on 18CT34 (no further revocation/suspension).  3 years probation ordered on 18CF543 and 18CF629 with various conditions, to include 120 days jail in 18CF543, stayed pending further order of the Court.

Cases called at 2:35 pm: 15CF549, 15CF550, 17CF127, 18CF543, 18CF629 and 18CT34.  Defendant Christopher L. Sewilo in custody with Attorney Mark Austin.  Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court indicates that there is not adequate time to resolve the matters today and requests an adjournment to 6/18/18 at 3:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 15, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
SPD Appointment - Attorney Mark Austin
Revocation warrant, order and packet.
